data.title: New Jersey Entertainers
data.text:
New Jersey has a rich history of contributing talent to the entertainment world, whether through theatre, television, movies or radio. In fact, no other category is as well-represented by Jerseyans as entertainment. All lists contain links when possible. I have included a separate category for Music.

William "Bud" Abbott - b. 1895 d. 1974

Asbury Park, NJ

The straight man in the world-famous comedy duo of Abbott and Costello, and one of 2 non-players inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame (the other being Lou Costello, see below).

Edie Adams - b. 1927 d. 2008

Tenafly, NJ

Born in Pennsylvania, raised in Tenafly, Adams was a Tony Award winning actress, and comedienne. Married to fellow Jerseyan Ernie Kovacs until his death. She also earned a vocal degree from Juilliard.

Alan Alda - b. 1936

Leonia, NJ

Born Alfonso Joseph D'Abruzzo in New York City, Alda is perhaps best known for his role as Hawkeye Pierce in the TV show M*A*S*H, but has done numerous other film and television productions. He commuted from LA to his home in New Jersey every weekend for 11 years while starring in "M*A*S*H. His wife and daughters lived in NJ, and he did not want to uproot the family to LA, especially because he did not know how long the show would last.

Jason Alexander - b. 1959

Newark, NJ

Born Jay Greenspan in Newark, Jason Alexander grew up in Livingston, NJ, and is best-known for playing "George Costanza" on the television series "Seinfeld".

John Amos - b. 1941 (?)

Newark, NJ

Film, television and stage actor, perhaps best known for his roles in Good Times and Roots.

Joan Bennett - b. 1910 d. 1990

Fort Lee, NJ

Hollywood actress, with most of her film career being in the 1930s and 1940s. Later appeared in Dark Shadows, the 1960s Gothic Horror soap opera, as family matriarch Elizabeth Collins Stoddard.

Credit for the correction to Tom Meyers, Fort Lee.

Jason Biggs - b. 1978

Pompton Plains, NJ

Born in Pompton Plains and raised in Hasbrouck Heights, Jason Biggs is probably best known for his roles in the "American Pie" movies, although he has appeared in numerous other films.

Thanks to Scott for this suggestion.

Vivian Blaine - b. 1921 d. 1995

Newark, NJ

Born Vivian Stapleton, Ms. Blaine is best known for her role in the Broadway and movie versions of the production of "Guys and Dolls". She also had numerous roles in other movie and television programs.

Suggestion courtesy of Nat Bodian.

Robert Blake - b. 1933

Nutley, NJ

Born Michael Gubitosi, Blake began a film career as one of the Little Rascals, but is perhaps best known for playing Baretta on TV.

Zach Braff - b. 1975

South Orange, NJ

Perhaps best known, at this time, for his role on the TV show "Scrubs". Braff has branched into writing and directing with the very well-done movie "Garden State".

Avery Brooks - b. 1948

New Brunswick, NJ

Born in Indiana, Brooks is a highly-regarded actor and director. Brooks is a tenured professor of Theater Arts at the Mason Gross School of the Arts at Rutgers University in New Jersey.

Thanks for this suggestion goes to John A. Santana.

Roscoe Lee Browne - b. 1925 d. 2007

Woodbury, NJ

Well-known character actor, with a very distinctive low voice, which led to numerous voiceover jobs as well. Also a champion track star, teacher of French...

Tisha Campbell-Martin - b.1968

Newark, NJ

Born in Oklahoma City, raised in Newark, Tisha Campbell is a noted television, film and stage actress.

Thanks to Tiffany Price for this suggestion.

David Copperfield - b. 1956

Metuchen, NJ

Born David Kotkin, Copperfield has become a world-famous magician. At age 12, he was the youngest person ever admitted to the American Society of Magicians.

Lou Costello - b. 1906 d. 1959

Paterson, NJ

Born Louis Francis Cristillo, the second and clown half of the famous comedy duo of Abbott and Costello. Costello's hometown of Paterson has a city park dedicated to his memory.

Joseph Cross - b. 1986

New Brunswick, NJ

An up and coming young actor, has been in numerous movies and television programs.

Thanks to Mark for this suggestion.

Tom Cruise - b. 1962

Glen Ridge, NJ

Born in Syracuse, NY, as Thomas Cruise Mapother IV, the actor better known as Tom Cruise attended 15 schools in 14 years, before his family settled in Glen Ridge. Recent years have seen Cruise focus more frequently on action movies.

Vincent Curatola - b.1953

Englewood, NJ

Perhaps best known for playing the character 'Johnny Sack' on "The Sopranos", Mr. Curatola worked as a mason before his wife convinced him to return to school to pursue a career in acting.

Joe Dante - b. 1946

Morristown, NJ

Director and producer of films, perhaps the best known being "Gremlins".

Hope Davis - b. 1964

Englewood, NJ

A Tenafly High School graduate, Davis has appeared in numerous movies, including American Splendor, opposite Paul Giamatti.

Thanks for this suggestion to John Brennan.

Sandra Dee - b. 1942 d. 2005

Bayonne, NJ

Born Alexandra Zuck, Sandra Dee's film career was at its peak in the 1950s and early 1960s. She was the original Gidget.

Brian De Palma - b. 1940

Newark, NJNoted film director, credited with such films as Carrie, Body Double and The Untouchables.

Danny DeVito - b. 1944

Neptune, NJ

As a producer, director, actor and important Hollywood personality, DeVito is immediately recognizable wherever he goes. His work on the television series Taxi will live forever.

Peter Dinklage - b. 1969

Morristown, NJ

Born in Morristown and raised in Mendham, Dinklage got his big break in the independent feature film "The Station Agent" that was set in New Jersey.

Michael Douglas - b. 1944

New Brunswick, NJ

Well-known television and film actor, as well as a movie producer. Oh yes, son of Kirk Douglas.

Kirsten Dunst - b. 1982

Point Pleasant, NJ

Still a young actress, Kirsten Dunst has been gradually making her mark. Ignore her at your peril. But seriously, Ms. Dunst has the chops to be the real thing. To be honest, I did not know she was NJ until recently.

Christine Ebersole - b. 1953

Maplewood, NJ

Born in Chicago, Illinois, Tony-award winner Ebersole has been in films, television and has recently returned to the stage on Broadway.

Madge Evans - b. 1909 d. 1981

Oakland, NJ

Born in New York, stage and screen actress Madge Evans moved to Oakland with her husband, playright Sidney Kingsley, where they lived for many years.

Vera Farmiga - b. 1973

Passaic, NJ

Born in Passaic, raised in Clifton, Farmiga, who had intended to be an optometrist, has seen her career take off in recent years.

Thanks to Bill Lewis for this suggestion.

Josh Flitter - b. 1994

Ridgewood, NJ

Obviously a young actor, but already has quite a bio.

Calista Flockhart - b. 1964

New Brunswick, NJ

Born in Illinois, Calista Flockhart's family moved to New Jersey where she attended high school in Medford, NJ. Also studied acting at Rutgers University in New Jersey. Best known as the lead role in the TV show "Ally MacBeal".

Thanks for this suggestion goes to Chris Holzhauer.

Thanks to Elizabeth Carmichael for the High School catch.

John Forsythe - b. 1918 d. 2010

Penns Grove, NJ

Born John Lincoln Freund, actor, known for the voice of Charlie in Charlie's Angels and Blake Carrington in Dynasty. His distinctive voice has led him to many narration jobs as well.

James Gandolfini - b. 1961

Westwood, NJ

A graduate of Rutgers University, Gandolfini, whogrew up in Park Ridge, is perhaps best known for his work as Tony Soprano on the ultra-popular HBO series The Sopranos. He has also appeared on over 20 films and plays.

Janeane Garofalo - b. 1964

Newton, NJ

Actress and comedian, Garofalo grew up in Madison, NJ. Her family moved to Houston in her senior year in high school.

Paul Gleason - b. 1939 d. 2006

Jersey City, NJ

A veteran character actor, most well-known for roles in "Trading Places" and "The Breakfast Club". He appeared in numerous film and television productions. You may not know the name, but you sure as heck know the face.

Savion Glover - b. 1974

Newark, NJ

Tap dancer and choreographer Savion Glover has been called by Gregory Hines "...perhaps the best tap dancer ever."

Ed Harris - b. 1950

Englewood, NJ

Born in Englewood and raised in Tenafly, an accomplished and intense actor, known for both supporting and lead roles.

Anne Hathaway - b. 1982

Millburn, NJ

Born in New York and raised in Millburn, began her career in television but has recently been in several very well-reviewed and received movies.

Sterling Hayden - b. 1916 - d. 1986

Montclair, NJ

Actor and author, perhaps best known as the character Gen. Jack D. Ripper in the movie Dr. Strangelove.

Robert Hegyes - b. 1951 d. 2012

Perth Amboy, NJ

Born in Perth Amboy but raised in nearby Metuchen, Hegyes is perhaps best known for his role on the TV show "Welcome Back Kotter". Attended college in New Jersey, and has also been in numerous other television shows.

Thanks to Stephanie Meechan for this suggestion.

Celeste Holm - b. 1917 d. 2012

Schooley's Mountain, NJ

Born in New York City, Ms. Holm appeared in many films and in TV programs. You most likely recognize her with the exclamation "Oh yeah, I know her!"

Linda Hunt - b. 1945

Morristown, NJ

Oscar-award winning actress, with an extensive list of movie and theater credits.

Stanley Kamel - b. 1943 d. 2008

South River, NJ

Actor perhaps best known as the psychiatirst in Monk.

Thanks to Dewey for this suggestion.

Brian Keith - b. 1921 d. 1997

Bayonne, NJ

Born Robert Keith, he was a well-known television and film actor, perhaps best known for his work in "Family Affair". Also a decorated World War 2 veteran.

Phyllis Kirk - b. 1927 d. 2006

Plainfield, NJ

Born Phyllis Kirkegaard, an actress with an extensive filmography, but perhaps best known for her role in the film "House of Wax".

Ernie Kovacs - b. 1919 d. 1962

Trenton, NJ

Writer, director, actor, artist, but perhaps best known for his comedy and his early television comedy show. Tragically killed in a car crash in California.

Jane Krakowski - b. 1968

Parsippany, NJ

Born Jane Krajkowski, versatile actress, known for her work on the TV shows "Ally McBeal" and "30 Rock", but also a Tony award winner for her role in the musical "Nine".

Michael Landon - b. 1936 d. 1991

Collingswood, NJ

Born Eugene Orowitz in Queens, NY, his family moved to New Jersey when he was 5 years old. Best known for his roles in the TV shows "Bonanza" and "Little House on the Prairie".

Thanks to Tim Pascucci for this suggestion.

Nathan Lane - b. 1956

Jersey City, NJ

Noted stage and film actor, perhaps best known for his role as Max Bialystock in the staged version of The Producers.

Frank Langella - b. 1940

Bayonne, NJ

Noted film and stage actor.

Jerry Lewis - b. 1926

Newark, NJ

Born Joesph Levitch in Newark, an actor, writer, comedian, director, producer and all around busy person. One half of the comedy duo (Dean) Martin and (Jerry) Lewis.

Richard Lewis - b. 1947

Englewood, NJ

Born in Brooklyn, raised in Englewood, this comedian/actor has appeared in several TV shows and has a long-running stand-up comedy career.

Thanks to Joanie for this suggestion.

Ray Liotta - b. 1955

Newark, NJ

Actor Ray Liotta has been in daytime soaps and movies, including a gig portraying fellow Jerseyan Frank Sinatra.

Bill Maher - b. 1956

River Vale, NJ

Born in New York, but raised in New Jersey, comedian/satirist/political commentator Maher is well-known for his intelligent yet funny late night TV show "Real Time".

Camryn Manheim - b. 1961

Caldwell, NJ

Born Debra Frances Manheim, Camryn grew up in Illinois. This Emmy Award-winning actress has appeared in numerous television programs in addition to several film projects.

John C. McGinley - b. 1959

Millburn, NJ

Born in New York City, McGinley was raised in Millburn. The owner of quite an extensive filmography and many credits on television, including "Scrubs".

Thanks for this suggestion goes to Peggy Bell.

Bob McGrath - 1932

Teaneck, NJ

Born in Illinois, McGrath is perhaps best known for his role on Sesame Street.

Thomas Mitchell - b. 1892 d. 1962

Elizabeth, NJ

Well-recognized character actor, perhaps best known as Scarlett O Hara's father in Gone With the Wind and as Uncle Billy in It's a Wonderful Life.

Thanks to John for this suggestion.

Jay Mohr - b. 1970

Verona, NJ

Actor and comedian, also a guest sportswriter for Sports Illustrated.

Thanks to Nick Frez for this suggestion.

Ozzie Nelson - b. 1906 d. 1975

Jersey City, NJ

Band leader during the 1930s, perhaps better known for the radio and TV show The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet.

Bebe Neuwirth - b. 1958

Princeton, NJ

Born Beatrice Neuwirth, an actress, singer, dancer, perhaps best known for playing "Lilith" on the TV shows Cheers and Frasier, however she has made a very successful career on Broadway.

Phyllis Newman - b. 1933

Jersey City, NJ

Tony Award-winning actress (1962), also a game show panelist and breast cancer survivor.

Thanks to Jersey Guy for this suggestion.

Jack Nicholson - b. 1937

Neptune, NJ

Although born in New York City, multi-Oscar winner Nicholson grew up on the Jersey Shore, graduating from Manasquan High School.

Joe Pantoliano - b. 1951

Hoboken, NJ

A well-known and busy character actor, "Joey Pants" as he is known, has appeared in many movies and television programs, and has also appeared on Broadway.

Thanks to John Brennan for this suggestion.

Piper Perabo - b. 1978

Toms River, NJ

Born in Dallas, Texas, raised in Toms River, where her father was a professor at Ocean County College. Has appeared in numerous movies.

Thanks to Kayla for this suggestion.

Joe Pesci - b. 1943

Newark, NJ

Oscar-winner Pesci has been appearing in movies for 20 years, though he has really only broken through in the past 10 years.

Joe Piscopo - b. 1951

Passaic, NJ

Actor and comedian, a one-time cast member of Saturday Night Live, known for his impression of fellow NJ person Frank Sinatra.

Keshia Knight Pulliam - b. 1979

Newark, NJ

Born in Newark, Keshia attended Rutgers Prep in Somerset, among other schools. Perhaps best known as "Rudy" on The Cosby Show, she has appeared in several movies.

Thanks to Mahogany Hendricks for this suggestion.

Tara Reid - b. 1975

Wyckoff, NJ

Tara got her career started as a child actor at age 6. Since then, she has starred in many movies, though her movie career has stalled at this time.

Suggested by Anthony Genchi.

Dan Resin - b. 1931 d. 2010

Secaucus, NJ

Born in Indiana, Dan Resin lived in New Jersey (Union City, Secaucus, Wayne) for the past 50 years. Perhaps best known as the Ty D Bol Man, and Dr. Beeper in "Caddyshack".

Anne Revere - b. 1903 d. 1990

Westfield, NJ

Born in New York, this Academy Award winning actress was raised in Westfield. She was also a direct descendant of Paul Revere.

Thanks to Mike Gordeuk for this suggestion.

Christina Ricci - b. 1980

Montclair, NJ

Born in Santa Monica, California, the family moved to Montclair, where Christina attended elementary, middle and high school. Has made various movies, not easy to pigeonhole, which will probably be good for her career.

Kelly Ripa - b. 1970

Stratford, NJ

Actress, but perhaps best known currently as co-host with Regis Philbin of the morning TV show Live with Regis and Kelly.

Paul Rudd - b. 1969

Passaic, NJ

Born in Passaic and raised in Kansas, Rudd is an extremely busy TV, film and stage actor.

Eva Marie Saint - b. 1924

Newark, NJ

Movie actress playing several memorable leading lady roles, including opposite Marlon Brando in "On The Waterfront" and Cary Grant in "North By Northwest".

Laura San Giacomo - b. 1962

Denville, NJ

Born in West Orange and raised in Denville, San Giacomo has appeared in film and perhaps more famously television.

Susan Sarandon - b. 1946

Edison, NJ

Born as Susan Tomalin in New York City, Sarandon is as well-known for her activism as she is for her filmography. Graduated from Edison High School.

John Sayles - b. 1950

Hoboken, NJ

Born in Schenactady, New York, Sayles lives in Hoboken. Well-respected independent filmmaker, Sayles has directed the films Return of the Secaucus Seven, Eight Men Out and Lone Star.

Natalie Schafer - b. 1900 d. 1991

Red Bank, NJ

A stage and film actress, perhaps best known for her role as Lovey Howell on Gilligan's Island.

Thanks to Tim Pascucci for this suggestion.

Dore Schary - b. 1905 d. 1980

Newark, NJ

Writer, director, producer in Hollywood and on Broadway. Also buried in New Jersey.

Roy Scheider - b. 1932 d. 2008

Orange, NJ

Film star who grew up in New Jersey, best known for his roles in Jaws and The Seven-Ups.

Kevin Smith - b. 1970

Red Bank, NJ

Filmmaker/director, best known for his Clerks films and the movie Dogma. Smith has set many of his films in New Jersey.

Thanks to Kelly for this suggestion.

Tasha Smith - b. 1971

Camden, NJ

Actress, activist and entrepreneur, with her own acting studio.

Mira Sorvino - b. 1967

Tenafly, NJ

Harvard educated, Oscar-winning actress Mira Sorvino is the daughter of veteran actor Paul Sorvino.

Kevin Spacey - b. 1959

South Orange, NJ

Multi-Oscar winner Spacey moved with his family to California while still a young child. Spacey is also an accomplished stage actor and impressionist.

John Spencer - b. 1946 d. 2005

Little Falls, NJ

Some sources claim Spencer was born in New York City, others say Paterson. Born John Speshock and raised in Little Falls, NJ, until the age of 16 before going to a performing arts school in Manhattan. Perhaps best known for his work on television's "The West Wing", until his untimely death in 2005.

Thanks to T. Capalbo for the additional data.

Jon Stewart - b. 1962

Lawrence Township, NJ

Born in New York as Jonathan Stuart Leibowitz, but raised in New Jersey, Stewart is considered one of America's top social and comedic voices. From his anchor chair of Comedy Central's "The Daily Show with Jon Stewart," he "has breathed new life into a show that hadn't even seemed to need it," said The New York Times.

Meryl Streep - b. 1949

Summit, NJ

Multi-Oscar winner Streep is considered by some to be the finest actress of her generation. Her 12 Oscar nominations placed her in a tie with the legendary Katherine Hepburn.

Loretta Swit - b. 1937

Passaic, NJ

Emmy Award winning actress, best know as "Hot Lips" Houlihan on the TV show "M*A*S*H".

Norma Talmadge - b. 1893 d. 1957

Jersey City, NJ

A model, but better known as an actress during the Silent Era.

John Travolta - b. 1954

Englewood, NJ

Actor who had his career resurrected with an Oscar nomination in Pulp Fiction. Travolta also starred in television (Welcome Back, Kotter) and movies such as Grease and Saturday Night Fever.

Lee Van Cleef - b. 1925 d. 1989

Somerville, NJ

Character actor, perhaps best known for his many supporting roles in Westerns in the 1960s. Van Cleef mostly played villains, but was versatile enough to play heroes(?) in movies and TV.

"Uncle" Floyd Vivino - b. 1951

Paterson, NJ

All around performer, last of a dying (dead?) breed. Floyd has been in movies and on television. His show is a real vaudeville throwback. Also well-known for his piano playing.

Patrick Warburton - b. 1964

Paterson, NJ

Perhaps best-known for playing David Puddy on Seinfeld, Warburton has had many other roles and has also done numerous voiceovers.

Jack Warden - b. 1920 d. 2006

Newark, NJ

Born John Lebzelter in Newark, Jack Warden was an Emmy award winning actor in films and television, best known for his many character roles. He tried his hand at professional boxing before joining the US military, turning to acting after World War 2 was over.

Alice White - b. 1904 d. 1983

Paterson, NJ

Born in Paterson as Alva White, the family moved to California when she was young, growing up in Los Angeles. Her career began during the silent era, when she was compared to Clara Bow, and continued into the 40s.

Bruce Willis - b. 1955

Penns Grove, NJ

Born in West Germany, Willis grew up mostly in Penns Grove. Has had numerous roles on television and in movies, as well as music performance.

Clerow "Flip" Wilson - b. 1933 d. 1998

Jersey City, NJ

Actor, comedian, hosted a successful TV variety show in the 1960s and 70s.

Robert Wuhl - b. 1951

Union, NJ

Comedian, writer and actor, possesses a very recogonizable face.

Jane Wyatt - b. 1910 d. 2006

Campgaw, NJ

Born in New Jersey but raised in New York City, actress perhaps best known for her roles as the mother on "Father Knows Best" and as Mr. Spock's mother in several Star Trek productions.

Ian Ziering - b. 1964

Newark, NJ

Born in Newark but raised in West Orange, Ian Ziering is perhaps best known for his role on the TV show Beverly Hills 90210. Also has several movies and other television shows to his credit.

Thanks to Peggy Bell for this suggestion.
